questions.question_text: Where State has not established minimum IFR altitudes, the minimum height of an aircraft above the highest obstacle over high terrain, or in mountainous areas shall be for an IFR flight:
options: At least 2000ft within 8km of the estimated position
At least 1000ft within 8km of the estimated position
At least 2000ft within 5km of the estimated position

questions.question_text: Aircraft wishing to conduct IFR flight within advisory airspace, but not electing to use the air traffic advisory service:
options: Need to file a flight plan
Shall nevertheless submit a flight plan but changes made thereto are not necessary to be notified
Shall nevertheless submit a and notify changes made thereto to the ATS unit providing that service

questions.question_text: The white dumb-bell with black perpendicular bar indicates that:
options: Taxiing need to be confined to the taxiways
Glider flying is performed outside the landing area
Landing, take-off and taxiing is allowed on runway and/or taxiway only

questions.question_text: Your aircraft is intercepted by a military aircraft. The signals given by this aircraft conflict with ATC instructions. You should:
options: Select code 7500 on your transponder
Follow ATC instructions
Follow the instructions of the intercepting aircraft

questions.question_text: An aircraft which is being subject to unlawful interference ("hijacked") and is forced to divert from the cleared track or cruising level without being able to communicate with ATS shall try to:
options: Fly the emergency triangle
Continue at an altitude that differs from the sernicircular rule with 1000ft when above FL 290 and 500ft when lower than FL 290
As soon as possible commence emergency descent in order to minimize the difference between cabin pressure and outside pressure

questions.question_text: An aircraft manoeuvering in an airport's circuit receives a series of red flashes from the control tower. This signifles that the aircraft must:
options: Not land for the moment regardless of previous instructions
Return to land and that clearance to land will be communicated in due course
Not land because the airport is not available for landing

questions.question_text: Whilst flying in an aerodrome's traffic circuit, an aircraft receives a series of green flashes from the tower. The aircraft:
options: Is cleared to land
Must land immediately and clear the landing area
Must come back to land and the landing clearance will be sent in due time

questions.question_text: Except when a clearance is obtained from an ATC unit, a VFR flight can not enter or leave a control zone when ceiling is less than:
options: 2000ft or visibility is less than 5km
1000ft or visibility is less than 5km
1500ft or visibility is less than 5km

questions.question_text: Which of the following flights has the greatest priority to land?
options: Emergency aircraft
Military aircraft
VIP (Head of state) aircraft

questions.question_text: An aircraft flying above the sea between 4500ft MSL and 9000ft MSL outside controlled airspace under VFR, must remain on principle at least:
options: 1500m horizontally, 1000ft vertically from clouds; 8km visibility
Clear of clouds and in sight of the surface; 8km visibility
1500m horizontally, 1000ft vertically from clouds; 5km visibility

questions.question_text: The VMC minima for an airspace classified as "B" above 10000ft MSL are:
options: 2000m horizontally, 1000ft vertically from clouds; 8km visibility
Clear of clouds; 8km visibility
1 nautical mile horizontally and 1000ft vertically from clouds; 8km visibility

questions.question_text: The VMC minima for an airspace classified as "G" above 10000ft MSL are:
options: 1500m horizontally, 1000ft vertically from clouds; 8km visibility
1 nautical mile horizontally and 1000ft vertically from clouds; 8km visibility
1 nautical mile horizontally and 1000ft vertically from clouds; 5km visibility

questions.question_text: Minimum vertical distance from cloud for VFR flight within controlled space is.
options: 500 ft

questions.question_text: Green flashes from Tower, this signal means that the aircraft:
options: May continue to taxy towards the take-off area
Must return to its point of departure
Must stop

questions.question_text: Which of the following actions shall be taken in case of a controlled flight deviates from the track?
options: Adjust the heading of the aircraft to regain track as soon as possible
If VMC, maintain this condition, waiting for the ATC instructions
Notify ATC of the new track immediately and comply with instructions

questions.question_text: An aircraft is flying under IFR in an area where the visibility is unlimited and the sky is clear (free of clouds), when it totally loses radio communications. The procedure to be followed is:
options: Descend to En-route Minimum Safe Altitude and join closest airfield open to IFR operations
Land on the closest appropriate aerodrome, then advise Air Traffic Services of landing
Continue flight onto destination, complying with last received clearances in the filed flight plan

questions.question_text: While taxiing an aircraft receives the following light signal from the control tower: series of red flashes. This signal means that the aircraft:
options: Must vacate the landing area in use
May continue to taxi to the take-off area
Must stop

questions.question_text: An aircraft intercepted by another aircraft shall immediately attempt to establish radio communication with the intercepting aircraft on the following frequencies:
options: 121.5MHz-243MHz

questions.question_text: If radio contact with the intercepting aircraft is established but communication on a common language is not possible, which phrase should be pronounced by the intercepted aircraft to communicate that he is unable to comply with the instructions received?
options: UNABLE TO COMPLY
CAN NOT
CAN NOT COMPLY

questions.question_text: If radiocommunication is established during an interception butcommunications in a common language is not possible, which phrase should be pronounced by the intercepting aircraft to request the intercepted aircraft to descend for landing?
options: Descend for landing
Descend
You land

questions.question_text: A signalman will ask the pilot to apply parking brakes by the following signals:
options: Arms down, palms facing inwards, moving arms from extended position inwards
Crossing arms extended above his head
Raise arm and hand, with fingers extended, horizontally in front of body, then clinch fist

questions.question_text: Within uncontrolled airspace, the first usable level in IFR must provide a 500 feet margin above the following two levels:
options: 3000 feet AMSL or 1500 feet AGL
3000 feet AMSL or 1000 feet AGL
FL 30 or 1500 feet AGL

questions.question_text: An aircraft shall display, if so equipped, an anti-collision light:
options: Outside the daylight-period at engine-start. During the daylight-period this is not applicable
On the ground when the engines are running
While taxiing, but not when it is being towed

questions.question_text: A red flare addressed to a flying aircraft means:
options: Dangerous airfield. Do not land
Not withstanding any previous instructions, do not land for the time being
Come back and land

questions.question_text: A double white cross displayed horizontally in the signal area means:
options: An area unit for the movement of aircraft
Need special precautions while approaching for landing
The aerodrome is being used by gliders and that glider flights are being performed

questions.question_text: An aircraft is considered to overtake another if it approaches the other aircraft from the rear on a line forming an angle of less than:
options: 50 degress with the plane of symmetry of the latter
70 degress with the plane of symmetry of the latter
60 degress with the plane of symmetry of the latter

questions.question_text: During an IFR flight in VMC in controlled airspace you experience a two-way radio communication failure. You will:
options: Land at the nearest suitable aerodrome maintaining VMC and inform ATC
Select A7600 and continue according current flightplan to destination
Land at the nearest suitable aerodrome and inform ATC

questions.question_text: When does FLIGHT TIME end?
options: When the aeroplane first stops after landing to disembark passengers
At touchdown
At engine shut down when the aeroplane has stopped in the parking bay

questions.question_text: The aerodrome at Calicut is not declared suitable for night operations. If the sunrise is at 0550 the earliest time by which an VFR aircraft operation at the station can take place is;
What is the meaning of AGL?
options: Altitude of ground level
Aerodrome ground level
Above ground level

questions.question_text: Which of the following defines flight visibility?
options: Visibility determined in flight not obscured by cloud, dust, haze or precipitation
The ability to determine in the air the distance and identity of unlighted objects by day and lighted objects by night
The forward visibility from the cockpit of an aircraft in flight

questions.question_text: When operating under Special VFR clearance, the responsibility for remaining clear of obstacles on the ground rests with:
options: Operator
The aircraft commander
Air traffic control

questions.question_text: Who shall have the final authority over the disposition of the aircraft?
options: The Authority
The Owner
The Commander

questions.question_text: The commander of a public transport aircraft must ensure that passenger seat belts are secure for:
options: Take-off, landing and turbulence
Take-off, landing, taxiing and turbulence
Take-off, landing, taxiing, turbulence and during emergencies

questions.question_text: Who decides whether to fly under IFR or VFR In VMC?
options: The PIC
The Operator
The ATS authority

questions.question_text: An aircraft being towed by night must display:
options: The same lights that are required in flight
Flashing navigation lights
Steady navigation lights

questions.question_text: Anti-collision lights on an aircraft must be switched on:
options: Between SS and SR or any other period specified by the appropriate authority
As soon as engines are running
All aircraft operating on the movement area

questions.question_text: When two aircraft are approaching head on, and there is a danger of collision:
options: Both aircraft alter heading to port
Both aircraft alter course to the right (starboard side)
The smaller aircraft alters heading to port

questions.question_text: A revised estimate shall be notified if the ETA destination passed by aircraft varies by:
options: 3 minutes
2 minutes
5 minutes

questions.question_text: An aircraft that has the right of way shall maintain its:
options: Heading and speed
Right of progress
Course, speed and height

questions.question_text: On aerodromes aircraft taxiing on the manoeuvring area of an aerodrome shall give way to:
options: Other converging aircraft
Aircraft taking off or about to take off
Other vehicles and pedestriants

questions.question_text: What is Special VFR?
options: A VFR procedure to enable an aeroplane to transit a control zone or area in IMC without compliance with IFR
A VFR flight cleared by ATC to operate within a CTR in meteorological conditions below VMC
Any flight cleared by ATC to operate in conditions less than VMC in which the pilot is required to remain clear of cloud and in sight of the surface

questions.question_text: Which is the correct order of priority:
options: Gliders do not give way to balloons.
Power-driven heavier-than-air aircraft shall give way to airships, gliders and balloons
Gliders shall give way to airships and balloons

questions.question_text: What is the minimum flight altitude permitted over towns and settlements and populated areas?
options: The altitude which permits the aircraft to land safely in the event of an engine failure
1000 ft above the highest obstacle within 600 m of the aircraft position
500 ft

questions.question_text: A controlled flight is requested to inform the appropriate ATC unit whenever the average True Air Speed at cruising level varies or is expected to vary from that given in the flight plan by plus or minus:
options: Mach 0.02

questions.question_text:
An aircraft operated on, or in the vicinity of, an aerodrome shall whether or not within an ATZ:
I) Observe other aerodrome traffic for the purpose of avoiding collision
II) Conform with or avoid the pattern of traffic formed by other aircraft in operation
III) Make all turns to the right, when approaching for landing or taking-off unless otherwise instructed
IV) Land and take-off into the wind unless safety, the runway configuration, or an air traffic consideration determines that a different direction should be used
options: All statements except II) are correct
All statements except 1) are correct
All statements except III) are correct

questions.question_text: Aircraft "A" with an ATC clearance is flying in VMC conditions within a control area. Aircraft "B" with no ATC clearance is approaching at appoximately the same altitude and on a converging course. Which is the right of way?
options: Aircraft "A" regardless of the direction which "B" is approaching
Aircraft "B" if "A" is on its left
Aircraft "A" If "B" is on its right

questions.question_text: Which action shall be taken by an aircraft in the traffic pattern of an aerodrome, experiencing radio failure to indicate difficulties which compel it to land without requiring immediate assistance?
options: Switching on and off four times the landing lights
The repeated switching on and off of the landing lights
Switching on and off three times the landing lights

questions.question_text: Aircraft taxling in the manoeuvring area must give way to:
options: Follow-me vehicles
Landing traffic
Departing and landing traffic

questions.question_text: Two or more white crosses, displayed on runways and taxiways, indicate that:
options: The threshold has been displaced
The section of the runway or taxiway is unfit for aircraft movement
The runway or taxiway should be used with caution

questions.question_text: During initial climb in uncontrolled airspace, the altimeter setting should be:
options: Any desired value
Local QNH
Standard pressure setting

questions.question_text: When a controlled flight inadvertently deviates from its current flightplan, ATC has to be informed in case:
options: Of an emergency
The estimated time is in error by more than 10 minutes
The TAS varies by plus or minus 5% of the TAS notified in the flightplan

questions.question_text: Which manoeuvre shall be executed by an intercepting aircraft if the pilot wants to communicate to the intercepted aircraft "YOU MAY PROCEED"?
options: Rocking wings and flashing the navigational lights
Executing a climbing turn of 90 degrees or more without crossing the line of flight of the intercepted aircraft
Circling the intercepted aircraft in a clock-wise pattern

questions.question_text: Semi-circular system sectors are.
options: From $000^{\circ}$ to $179^{\circ}$ and $180^{\circ}$ to $359^{\circ}$
From $090^{\circ}$ to $260^{\circ}$ and $270^{\circ}$ to $089^{\circ}$

questions.question_text: While on IFR flight, a pilot has an emergency which causes a deviation from an ATC clearance. What action must be taken?
options: Squawk 7700
The appropriate ATC unit shall be notified of the action taken as soon as circumstances permit
Request an amended clearance or cancel the IFR flightplan

questions.question_text: Outside controlled airspace above 3000'AMSL
options: Fly on 1013.2
QFE
QNH

questions.question_text: An airborne flight plan must be submitted:
options: 30 minutes before the intended point of entry into a CTA or advisory area
10 minutes before the intended point of entry into a CTA or advisory area
60 minutes before the intended point of entry into a CTA or advisory area

questions.question_text: IFR flight in VMC, weather changes to IMC:
options: Fly VMC and land at nearest convenient aerodrome.
Fly according to flight plan
Change to VFR plan

questions.question_text: PIC of an aeroplane shall
options: Be responsible for safe conduct of navigation
Be responsible for safe conduct of flight at all times
All above is correct

questions.question_text: On the ground, when two aircraft are approaching head on:
options: Both airplanes must stop or where practicable alter course to the right to keep well clear
Both should declare an urgency
Traffic patrol has to be informed

questions.question_text: No aircraft shall be flown over the congested area of cities, towns or settlements unless at a height that will permit, In the event of an emergency a landing to be made safely. Exceptions to this rule are:
options: Take-off and landing and permission from the appropriate authority
Permission from the appropriate authority
Take-off and landing

questions.question_text: Which type of service is provided in Class F airspace:
options: Air traffic control service
Air traffic advisory service and FIS
Air traffic advisory service

questions.question_text: When is deviation from the rules of the air permitted?
options: Only in the interests of flight safety
Only when it is economically advantageous
Anytime the PIC thinks it is necessary

questions.question_text: One of the following statements about aircraft ground movement is correct:
options: A taxing aircraft has priority over a vehicle towing an aircraft
A vehicle towing an aircraft has priority over a taxiing aircraft
Two airplanes approaching head-on will alter course to the left

questions.question_text: While flying at night another aircraft reports that you are on his 100 degrees relative bearing. In that case you should see his:
options: Red navigation light
Green navigation light
Green and white navigation lights

questions.question_text: The signal from pilot to marshaller which means - brakes applied - is:
options: Fist clenched in front of the face then fingers extended
Hands crossed in front of the face, palms outwards, then move arms outwards
Right arm and hand with fingers extended in front of face, then clench fist

questions.question_text: What does a red flashing light from the control tower to an aircraft on the manoeuvring area mean?
options: Clear to taxi
Return to the start point
Move clear of the landing area

questions.question_text: A series of red flashes sent to an aircraft in flight means:
options: Return to the airfield and land
Airfield is unsafe, do not land
Notwithstanding any other instructions do not land at the moment

questions.question_text: A white dumbbell with a black bar spaced perpendicularly Indicates
options: All aircraft are required to land, takeoff and taxi on taxiways and runways only.
Are required to land and takeoff on runways only
A white dumbbell when displayed requires a/c to land and takeoff and taxi on taxiways and runways only.

questions.question_text: A red square panel with a yellow strip along each diagonal, displayed in the signals area of an aerodrome indicates:
options: Aerodrome is unfit for aircraft movements, and landing are prohibited
Exercise special care when landing
Land on paved surface only

questions.question_text: Two a/c of same category converging...
options: Both will turn to right
Aircraft on right will turn right
Aircraft on the left will give way

questions.question_text: A signalman will ask the pilot to apply parking brakes by the following signals:
options: Raise arm and hand, with fingers extended, horizontally in front of body, then clench fist
Arms down, palms facing inwards, moving arms from extended position inwards.
Horizontally moving his hands, fingers extended, palms toward ground

questions.question_text: An aircraft is following a track of $179^{\circ}$ (M) on a VFR plan. The choice of flight levels available to the pilot are:
After an aircraft has been intercepted in flight, the intercepted aircraft is rocking its wings. This means:
options: Will comply
NO
you are not to enter this airspace

questions.question_text: All flights above flight levels are to be cleared IFR Irrespective of weather Conditions
A flashing intermittent red light from the ground to an aircraft in the air means:
options: Continue for another approach
Go-around
Aerodrome unsafe, do not land

questions.question_text: When a pilot raises his arms extended palms facing outwards and moves his hands inwards to cross in front of the face this means:
options: Remove chocks
Insert chocks
Brakes released

questions.question_text: While taxiing, an aircraft receives from the airport controller the following light signal: a series of green flashes. This signal means that the aircraft:
options: Must stop
May continue to taxi towards the take-off area
Must return to its point of departure

questions.question_text: A black letter "C" on a yellow background indicates:
options: The location of the control tower.
The location where visiting pilots should report.
Rest-room facilities for visiting pilots.

questions.question_text: At an aerodrome special VFR may be authorized when
options: Visibility falls below 5 km or cloud ceiling is less than 1500 feet
Visibility falls below 8 km or cloud ceiling is less than 1500 feet
Visibility falls below 8 km or cloud ceiling is less than 2500 feet

questions.question_text: A special VFR clearance may be obtained from ATC for the following airspaces:
options: CTR, TMA and AWY
CTR and TMA
CTR

questions.question_text: If the sustained Mach number/true airspeed at cruising level varies by plus or minus true airspeed or more from the current flight plan, the appropriate air traffic services unit shall be so informed:
options: Mach 0.2
19 km/h

questions.question_text: On a VFR flight, your magnetic track is $005^{\circ}$, the magnetic heading $355^{\circ}$. Which of the following flight level is correct?
options: FL 70
FL 55
FL 60

questions.question_text: The VMC minima for an airspace classified as "G" above 10 000 feet MSL are:
options: 1500 m horizontally and 1 000 feet vertically from clouds; 8 km visibility.
1 nautical mile horizontally and 1 000 feet vertically from clouds; 5 km visibility
1 nautical mile horizontally and 1000 feet vertically from clouds; 8 km visibility

questions.question_text: Which provisions on a VFR-flight in Class E airspace are CORRECT?
options: Service provided Traffic Information as far as practical; ATC Clearance: required:
Service provided: Traffic Information as far as practical; ATC Clearance: not required:
Service provided: Air Traffic Control Service; ATC Clearance: required;

questions.question_text: If you are flying IFR in IMC conditions and you experience a total communications failure, you should:
options: Continue the flight according to flight plan
Land at the nearest suitable aerodrome and report to ATS
Try to contact another aircraft for relay

questions.question_text: When flying on an airway on a heading of $255^{\circ}$ (M) the correct flight level will be:
options: Usually EVEN
Usually ODD
Always EVEN

questions.question_text: You are outside controlled airspace on a VFR flight above 3,000ft. Your distance from the cloud should be:
options: Clear of cloud and in sight of the surface
1,000 ft vertically and 1.5 km horizontally
2,000 ft and 3 NM horizontally

questions.question_text: In areas where a separation minimum of 1000 ft. is applied up to FL 410, authorisation for VFR flight shall not be granted above which flight level?
options: FL 200
FL 290
FL 240

questions.question_text: When an aircraft is operating in class Fairspace below 900 m amsl the minimum horizontal distance from cloud for VFR flight is:
options: 5 km
Clear of cloud and in sight of the surface

questions.question_text: SVFR may be authorized when the ground visibility is not less than:
Which of the following aerodrome ground signals displayed in the signals area indicates that glider flying is in progress?
options: A white double cross
A white dumb-bell
A black letter - Con a yellow background

questions.question_text: In areas where a vertical separation minimum (VSM) of 300 m (1000 ft) is applied between FL 290 and FL 410 inclusive an aircraft on a magnetic track of $350^{\circ}$ would be expected to fly at:
options: FL 410
FL 405
FL 400

questions.question_text: Above flight level FL 290 (non-RVSM) the vertical flight separation between aircraft on the same direction is:
Aircraft shall not be flown in formation except:
options: Formation flying is not permitted in India for civil aircraft.
By pre-arrangement among the pilots taking part
By pre-arrangement among the PICs taking part

questions.question_text: If the ground visibility is reported 1000 m, can a special VFR flight take off from an aerodrome in a control zone?
options: Yes, provided the cloud ceiling is higher than 500 ft
No
Yes, provided the pilot remains in visual contact with the ground

questions.question_text: A VFR flight when flying inside an ATS airspace classified as C has to maintain the following minima of flight visibility and distance from clouds
options: 5km at or above 3050m (10000ft) AMSL 1500m horizontal and 300m vertical from clouds
8km at or above 3050m (10000ft) AMSL, and clear of clouds
8km at or above 3050m (10000ft) AMSL 1500m horizontal and 300m vertical from clouds

questions.question_text:
When, in airspace where VFR are permitted, the pilot in command of an IFR flight wishes to continue his flight in accordance with visual flight rules, until the destination is reached:
1 He must inform the control unit ("cancel IFR")
2 He must request and obtain clearance
3 He may request his IFR flightplan to be changed to a VFR flightplan
4 The flightplan automatically becomes a VFR flightplan
The combination of correct statements is:
In the event of a delay of a controlled flight, the submitted flightplan should be amended or cancelled and a new flightplan submitted when the delay is:
options: 30 minutes in excess of the estimated time of departure
30 minutes in excess of the estimated time off blocks
60 minutes in excess of the estimated time of departure

questions.question_text: Changing of flight rules from IFR to VFR is possible
options: If the commander so requests
If instructed by ATC so long as VMC is forecasted during the next 30 minutes
Only when leaving controlled airspace

questions.question_text: ADC Validity Period is:
options: (-) 15 minutes to (+) 45 minutes of EOBT in RPL/FPL
(+) 60 minutes of EOBT in RPL/FPL
(-) 15 minutes to (+) 30 minutes of EOBT in RPL/FPL

questions.question_text: Flight Plan is to be filed atleast?
options: One hour before EOBT
Three hours before EOBT
One hour before TOBT

questions.question_text: In the event of a proposed delay of or more to the departure time for a flight plan when a flight plan has been previously filed, the Pilot-in-Command or his representative will be required to notify ATC of the revised ETD
options: 60 minutes
30 minutes
15 minutes
